alert.note: Alert for Bates; Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 9:06AM CDT until further notice by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Osage River near Schell City. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, flood waters impact all of the low lying areas in the Schell Osage Conservation Area as well as several county roads west of Schell City. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 32.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Saturday was 32.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 32.4 feet this evening. It will then fall to 32.3 feet and begin rising again tomorrow morning. It will rise to 32.5 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 32.5 feet on 09/18/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 915 AM CDT.
